summary: Vivian L. McPherson was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears in multiple payroll certifications and payroll records from the HSCA, spanning from October 1976 to December 1977, and again in May 1978. These documents list her as an employee, detailing her salary and pay period earnings. The redaction of Social Security Numbers in one document indicates a concern for personal privacy.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Vivian L. McPherson's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify her role within the committee, her presence on the payroll indicates she was involved in the operations of the HSCA during its investigation.
